intro: Sebaea cleistantha, commonly known as the silverleaf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Sebaea cleistantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
